td.b: Early Learning Goal 1 - Listening and Attention (LA)

ui.li: Listens attentively in a range of situations
Listens to stories, accurately anticipating key events and respond to what they hear with relevant comments, questions or actions.
Gives attention to what others say and respond appropriately, while engaged in another activity
Follows instructions involving several ideas or actions
Answer ‘how’ and ‘why’ questions about experiences and in response to stories or events
Expresses themselves effectively, showing awareness of listeners’ needs
Use past, present and future forms accurately when talking about events that have happened or are to happen in the future
Develops own narratives and explanations by connecting ideas or events

table.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height:auto;border-collapse: collapse;

td.b: Early Learning Goal 4 – Moving and Handling (MH)

ui.li: Shows good control and co-ordination in large and small movements
Moves confidently in a range of ways, safely negotiating space
Handles equipment and tools effectively, including pencils for writing

td.b: Early Learning Goal 5 – Health and Self-Care (HSC)

ui.li: Knows importance for good health of physical exercise, and healthy diet and talk about ways to keep healthy and safe
Manages own basic hygiene and personal needs successfully including dressing and going to the toilet independently

table.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height:auto;border-collapse: collapse;

td.b: Early Learning Goal 6 – Self-Confidence and Self-Awareness (SC SA)

ui.li: Is confident to try new activities
Can say why likes some activities more than others
Is confident to speak in a familiar group
Will talk about own ideas
Will choose the resources needed for chosen activities
Says when they do or don’t need help

td.b: Early Learning Goal 7 - Managing Feelings and Behavior (MFB)

ui.li: Talks about how they and others show feelings
Talks about their own and others’ behavior and its consequences and know that some behavior is unacceptable
Works as part of a group or class and understands and follows the rules
Adjusts behavior to different situations
Takes changes of routine in stride
Plays co-operatively, taking turns with others
Takes account of other’s ideas about how to organize activity
Shows sensitivity to others’ needs and feelings
Forms positive relationships with adults and other children

table.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height:auto;border-collapse: collapse;

ui.li: Reads and understand simple sentences
Uses phonic knowledge to decode regular words and reads then aloud accurately
Reads some common irregular words
Demonstrates understanding when talking with others about what they have read
Uses phonic knowledge to write words in ways which match spoken sounds
Writes some irregular common words
Writes simple sentences which can be read by themselves and others
Words are spelt correctly and others are phonetically plausible

table.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height:auto;border-collapse: collapse;

ui.li: Counts reliably with numbers from 1 to 20
Places numbers in order
Says which number is one more or one less than a given number
Uses quantities and objects adds and subtracts to single-digit numbers and counts on or back to find the answer
Solves problems including doubling, halving and sharing

td.b: Early Learning Goal 12- Shape, Space and Measure (SMM)

ui.li: Uses everyday language to talk about size, weight, capacity, position, distance, time and money to compare quantities and objects and to solve problems
Recognizes, creates and describes patterns
Explores characteristics of everyday objects and shapes and uses mathematical language to describe them

table.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height:auto;border-collapse: collapse;

td.b: Early Learning Goal 13- People and Communities (C)

ui.li: Can talk about past and present events in own lives and in the lives of own family members
Knows that other children don’t always enjoy the same things, and are sensitive to this
Knows about similarities and differences between themselves and others, and among families, communities and traditions
Knows about similarities and differences in relation to places, objects, materials and living things
Can talk about the features of own immediate environment and how environments might vary from one to another
Can make observations of animals and plants and explain why some things occur, and talk about changes
Recognizes that a range of technology is used in places such as homes and the TDCC
Selects and uses technology for particular purposes

table.style: border: 1px solid black; width: 100%; height:auto;border-collapse: collapse;

td.b: Early Learning Goal 16- Exploring Media and Materials (EMM)

ui.li: Can sing songs, make music and dance, and experiment with ways of changing them
Can safely use and explore a variety of materials, tools and techniques, experimenting with color, design, texture form and function
Can use what learnt about media and materials in original ways, thinking about uses and purposes
Can represent own ideas, thoughts and feelings through design and technology, art, music, dance, role play and stories
